review.title: A Hybrid Solution to improve Iteration Efficiency in the Distributed Learning
review.abstract: Currently, many machine learning algorithms contain lots of iterations. When it comes to existing large-scale distributed systems, some slave nodes may break down or have lower efficiency. Therefore traditional machine learning algorithm may fail because of the instability of distributed system.We presents a hybrid approach which not only own a high fault-tolerant but also achieve a balance of performance and efficiency.For each iteration, the result of slow machines will be abandoned. Then, we discuss the relationship between accuracy and abandon rate. Next we debate the convergence speed of this process. Finally, our experiments demonstrate our idea can dramatically reduce calculation time and be used in many platforms.

metadata.title: A hybrid solution to improve iteration efficiency in the distributed learning

sections.text: The result is that the demand for scalable disrupted platforms and frameworks in many areas, including machine learning and distributed frameworks, appears to be leading to the optimization of the iteration process for higher efficiency and lower costs. A framework called Spark [1], which uses a machine learning library (MLlib), has improved efficiency in many applications, and its modified solution, Resilient Datasets [2], accelerates data storage to an astonishing speed.
